data.title: Nathan Fillion – Bio, Married, Wife/Partner, Age, Net worth, Height
data.meta_description: Nathan Fillion is a multi-award-winning actor who rose to the mainstream for his outstanding portrayal of Joey Buchanan on the 1994 soap opera. a life to
data.text:
Nathan Fillion is a multi-award-winning actor who rose to the mainstream for his outstanding portrayal of Joey Buchanan on the 1994 soap opera. a life to live . He carved a niche for himself in the entertainment industry, starring in many highly successful Hollywood films and TV series such as Firefly, Serenity, Waitress, Castle and Dr. Horrible Sing-Along Blog . He is also a voice actor, providing his voice in many blockbuster animated films and TV series such as Cars 3, Robot Chicken DC Comics Special 3: Magical Friendship, and Guardians of the Galaxy .

He has also appeared in several video games including Family Guy: The Search for Things, Con Man: The Game, Cars 3: Driven To Win, Destiny 2, and Halo 5: Guardians. Nathan Fillion is also a producer and has produced many films and TV shows including Uncharted: Live-Action Fan Film and The Beginner . The multifaceted actor is also a humanitarian worker who co-founded an NGO (Non-Governmental Organization) with PJ Haarsma called Kids Need To Read. Read on to learn more about Nathan Fillion.

Nathan Fillion’s Biography (Age)

The fabled actor who has charmed the entertainment industry for more than two decades, Nathan Christopher Fillion was born to Robert Bob Fillion and June Cookie on March 27, 1971 in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. His parents previously worked as English teachers. His older brother, Jeff Fillion, followed in his parents’ footsteps and is Principal of St. Richards Edmonton Catholic School.

Fillion had his childhood experiences in MillWoods, Edmonton. He completed his undergraduate education at Holy Trinity Catholic High School and continued his education by enrolling at Concordia University College in Alberta and the University of Alberta in Canada.

Nathan Fillion made his first on-screen appearance when he starred as Master Warrant Officer Tom Jardine in the 1993 TV movie. Torture in the Arctic . He moved to New York the following year and landed the role of Joey Buchanan on the TV series, One Life to Live. The critically acclaimed series spawned the feisty actor’s fame and net worth, which earned him a 1996 Soap Opera Digest Awards nomination and a 1996 Daytime Emmy Awards nomination. It boded great things for Fillion as he eventually enjoyed an influx of film and TV roles between 1997 and 1999, including appearing as Minnesota Ryan in Saving Private Ryan, Total Safetyas Troy Larson, Maggie Winters among others as Ronald.
